With a thrilling finish, New Zealand clinched the T20i series against Sri Lanka.
Kane Williamson scored a brilliant half-century that anchored New Zealand's innings.
The match saw a dramatic final over where Trent Boult defended 10 runs successfully.
Sri Lanka put up a strong fight with a valiant 48 from Kusal Perera.
This victory marks New Zealand's first series win against Sri Lanka this year.
Tim Southee took three crucial wickets, denting Sri Lanka's chase significantly.
New Zealand's win was celebrated across the country, with fans praising the team's performance.
In what seemed like a turning point, Daryl Mitchell took a stunning catch at the boundary.
Despite the loss, Sri Lanka's batting display showcased their potential to be a top contender.
The match was an exhibition of excellent sportsmanship from both sides.
